story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Sudan, there was a kind and curious young boy named Ali. Ali lived in a small village near the Nile River, where he spent his days playing with his friends and helping his family with their daily chores.

One day, while Ali was playing near the river, he saw a beautiful bird with feathers of every color of the rainbow. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a beautiful song that echoed across the water.

Ali was so captivated by the bird's beauty and song that he decided to follow it as it flew deeper into the jungle. The bird led Ali through the lush greenery, over babbling brooks, and past towering trees until they reached a hidden clearing.

In the center of the clearing stood a magnificent tree, taller and wider than any Ali had ever seen before. The bird perched on a branch and sang even more beautifully than before, and Ali couldn't help but feel a sense of wonder and awe.

As Ali approached the tree, he noticed that it was covered in sparkling jewels of every color. He reached out and touched one, and it began to glow and hum with a magical energy.

Suddenly, the tree began to speak, and Ali was shocked to hear a kind and gentle voice coming from its trunk.

"Hello, young one," the tree said. "I have been watching you, and I can see that you are kind and curious. I am the magical tree of Sudan, and I have the power to grant you one wish. What would you like more than anything in the world?"

Ali thought for a moment, and then he knew exactly what he wanted.

"I wish for my village to have enough food and water for everyone, no matter the season," Ali said.

The magical tree nodded, and a warm, golden light enveloped the village. When the light faded, Ali saw that the fields were full of lush, green crops, and the river was flowing with clean, clear water.

Ali ran back to his village, and when he arrived, he saw that his wish had come true. The villagers were overjoyed, and they thanked Ali for his kind and selfless wish.

From that day on, Ali was known as the hero of his village, and he spent the rest of his days helping those in need and spreading kindness wherever he went.

As Ali drifted off to sleep that night, he knew that he would always be grateful for the magical tree of Sudan and the wish that had changed his life forever.

"Goodnight my son," the father said, "May you always be as kind and curious as Ali, and may all your dreams come true."

The son smiled, hugged his father and closed his eyes, ready to embark on his own magical journey in his dreams.
